title: Advanced Literary Analysis: Character Development

vocab.definition: A character who contrasts with another to highlight particular qualities
A character who remains essentially unchanged throughout the story
A complex character with multiple personality traits and motivations
A simple character with only one or two defining traits
A universal character type that appears across cultures and literature

teachingNotes: Compare different character types and their functions. Analyze how authors use foils and archetypes to enhance themes.

sample.question: What is a character who contrasts with another to highlight qualities?

truefalse.question: A round character has complex, multiple personality traits.

multiplechoice.question: What type of character remains essentially unchanged?

fillintheblank.question: A universal character type that appears across cultures is an ________.

shortanswer.question: What is the purpose of using character foils in literature?
